reviewText: The spool cracked on my disc 1 and broke.  So I got ANOTHER "Ren & Stimpy Show - The Complete First And Second Seasons".  When your cleaning them, MAKE SURE THAT THE SPOOL IS NOT CRACKED!!  YOU EEEDIOT!
Title: The Ren & Stimpy Show: The First and Second Seasons - Uncut

reviewText: This review is for the Ren and Stimpy Best Of Volume 2 and not the show itself (which is without question awesome!). Now you're probably watching an episode from this compilation on Amazon Instant right now like Jimminy Lummox, Prehistoric Stimpy, or A Hard Day's Luck and asking yourself while watching one of them "Hey! I remember another scene after this part. What happened?" Well, I'll tell you. You see, when it was announced that Ren and Stimpy would be released on DVD, fans were just happy, happy when they hoped the episodes would be presented uncut (some episodes like The Big Baby Scam for example were later edited for repeats). Unfortunately, when it was released, most of the episodes were the TNN/Spike TV masters. These masters aired when Spike was called TNN to commemorate the newest and adult-themed incarnation of the show; Ren and Stimpy's Adult Party Cartoon (a show I myself don't really like). The result to these masters were fake fade-in/outs which were made to make room for commercials, DVNR, time compression (a process in which something is sped up mostly due to make room for more commercials), and cuts made for time. John K. didn't even know! When the next volume featuring the Games Animation episodes were announced, fans hope that they too would remain uncut. Sadly, they too were cut and to add insult to injury, these cuts were made for no reason whatsoever (I doubt these versions aired on TNN)! To make matters worse, the same thing happened to the 3rd and final volume. What you're watching on Amazon Instant are the DVD versions (and I'm talking about on all 3 of the Ren and Stimpy Amazon Instant compilations). I have a list of the following episodes on this compilation that are cut:-Jimminy Lummox-Bass Master-Road Apples-Bass Master-Lair of the Lummox-I Love Chicken (also time compressed)-Waffle Woman vs. Powdered Toastman (also time compressed)-Prehistoric Stimpy (also time compressed)-Farmhands (also time compressed)-Ren's Retirement (also time compressed)-House of Next Tuesday (also time compressed)-Friend in Your Face (also time compressed)-Magical Singing Cheese-A Hard Day's LuckRemaning cartoons in this compilation are the original uncut versions that aired on Nick. The question I wanna know is who was responsible for these edits and why did they do it? My only hope is that Shout! Factory can sub-license the show from Nick/Viacom and release every single episode of the original Nick series uncut and unedited.As for the Games Animation era of the show, I love it. While the show's original creator John K. is not there, his collaborator Bob Camp is there (a choice that Nick made when they unfornately fired John K. and decided who should be put in charge of the show a very wise move indeed) as well as several members of the Spumco team (Jim Gomez, Bill Wray, and Scott Willis for example) and Billy West who in addition to Stimpy now voices Ren for the remainder of the show's run (not as good as when John K. voiced him, but still good nonetheless). Plus, there's some good talent from the Games crew members such as Michael Kim, Steve Loter, Ron Hughart (who went on as supervising director on American Dad) and Tom McGrath (who went on to co-create the Madagascar franchise and direct Megamind both for DreamWorks). There is no questions that wheather Spumco or Games, Ren and Stimpy is simply the best Nicktoon of the 90's (next to Rocko's Modern Life, Aahhh!!! Real Monsters, CatDog, and Spongebob Squarepants) and is one of the cartoons that (I think) revolutionized TV cartoons.
summary: Beware! DVD Versions and not Original Versions!
Title: The Ren & Stimpy Show: The First and Second Seasons - Uncut

reviewText: This is definately a must have for any Ren & Stimpy fan, prior to when MTV got ahold of the cartoon series.  Excellent price for the package DVD set.
summary: A Must Have for Any Ren & Stimpy Fan

reviewText: With John K. out, this clearly wasn't the same humor and quality of the first season. Not worthless, just way lower in concept and art.

reviewText: Who doesn't love Ren and Stimpy?  Excellent program and laugh out loud humor.  But, definitely not for young kids - I don't think they would understand!
Title: The Ren & Stimpy Show: The First and Second Seasons - Uncut

reviewText: The original season shows are great.  Sophisticated. ..creative...clever. ..superb...references...great audio tracks and innovative animation.  Everything that followed was a caricature of the genius of the first season.
summary: the original episodes of ren and stimpy are great
Title: The Ren & Stimpy Show: The First and Second Seasons - Uncut
